questions.explanation:
7. Why is there no flour on the shelf?
(A) Because it's out of stock. → Correct (directly explains the reason for no flour)
(B) Those roses smell nice. → Incorrect (unrelated to flour availability)
(C) No, the other cake. → Incorrect (refers to a cake, not flour)

8. When will the catering company arrive?
(A) At four o'clock. → Correct (specifies the arrival time)
(B) That's a delicious flavor. → Incorrect (unrelated to arrival time)
(C) Many vegetarian options. → Incorrect (refers to menu, not timing)

9. When's the meeting scheduled to start?
(A) At a networking event. → Incorrect (refers to location, not time)
(B) I started this job six years ago. → Incorrect (unrelated to meeting time)
(C) Right after lunch. → Correct (specifies the meeting start time)

10. How much will the repairs cost?
(A) I have two pairs of shoes. → Incorrect (unrelated to repair costs)
(B) Around 200 dollars. → Correct (directly states the cost)
(C) The restaurant downtown. → Incorrect (refers to location, not cost)

11. You went to the dentist this morning, didn't you?
(A) Oh, I've already had breakfast. → Incorrect (unrelated to dentist visit)
(B) Yes, for an annual checkup. → Correct (confirms the dentist visit)
(C) Let's take the bus. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

12. Where should we put the new printer?
(A) In the corner by the stairs. → Correct (specifies a location for the printer)
(B) The third page of the document. → Incorrect (unrelated to printer placement)
(C) A reusable ink cartridge. → Incorrect (refers to printer supplies, not location)

13. What type of plant do you have in your office?
(A) Whenever I sit at my desk. → Incorrect (refers to time, not plant type)
(B) Thanks-I just bought it. → Incorrect (unrelated to plant type)
(C) One that doesn't require much water. → Correct (describes the plant type)

14. There was a sale at the furniture store.
(A) No, it wasn't in storage. → Incorrect (unrelated to the sale)
(B) Did you buy anything? → Correct (logical response to the sale statement)
(C) Some old receipts. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the sale)

15. Can you show me how to submit a tech help ticket?
(A) Let me send you the link. → Correct (offers assistance with the process)
(B) A broken power cable. → Incorrect (describes an issue, not the process)
(C) No, over ten minutes. → Incorrect (refers to time, not submission)

16. Where is the power button on this device?
(A) I've never used that model before. → Correct (addresses familiarity with the device)
(B) Ten euros per hour. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not button location)
(C) We charge more for color photographs. → Incorrect (unrelated to the device)

17. Do you want to take a walk now, or would later be better?
(A) A nearby lake. → Incorrect (refers to location, not timing)
(B) I'm free to walk now. → Correct (specifies preference for timing)
(C) No, I don't use a fitness tracker. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

18. I ordered some new equipment for the factory.
(A) The news program on Channel Ten. → Incorrect (unrelated to equipment)
(B) Great-I can't wait to use it. → Correct (acknowledges the equipment order)
(C) The car dealership. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the factory)

19. There's a nice place to rent on Mercer Street.
(A) I just renewed my current lease. → Correct (relevant response to the rental statement)
(B) It was a great show. → Incorrect (unrelated to renting)
(C) A standard rental application. → Incorrect (refers to process, not response)

20. Is the heating system working?
(A) Yes, that's my Web site. → Incorrect (unrelated to heating system)
(B) A five-kilometer run. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I just called maintenance. → Correct (implies addressing the system's status)

21. Isn't the roadwork in front of city hall finished yet?
(A) I just finished my conference presentation. → Incorrect (unrelated to roadwork)
(B) A lot of traffic in the evening. → Incorrect (describes traffic, not completion)
(C) No, they still have another month to go. → Correct (confirms roadwork status)

22. Who will lead the new-employee training today?
(A) We're using a recorded video. → Correct (explains the training method)
(B) Yes, right after lunch. → Incorrect (refers to time, not leader)
(C) Classroom 124. → Incorrect (refers to location, not leader)

23. Is the safety inspection scheduled for this month or next month?
(A) I thought I saved the file. → Incorrect (unrelated to inspection schedule)
(B) The factory supervisor. → Incorrect (refers to a person, not timing)
(C) It's this Wednesday. → Correct (specifies the inspection time)

24. When is the harvest festival taking place?
(A) It's a week from tomorrow. → Correct (specifies the festival timing)
(B) Sure, I can take it. → Incorrect (unrelated to the festival)
(C) The park next to the art museum. → Incorrect (refers to location, not time)

25. Was your new laptop expensive?
(A) Do you have a new password? → Incorrect (unrelated to laptop cost)
(B) I had a discount coupon. → Correct (addresses the cost indirectly)
(C) On top of the cabinet. → Incorrect (refers to location, not cost)

26. Why don't we go on our camping trip next weekend?
(A) Yes, that table lamp is quite nice. → Incorrect (unrelated to camping)
(B) Should we go left or right? → Incorrect (refers to directions, not agreement)
(C) I have a performance scheduled with my band. → Correct (explains unavailability)

27. The workshop for this afternoon was postponed, wasn't it?
(A) At the post office. → Incorrect (unrelated to postponement)
(B) I haven't checked my e-mail. → Correct (implies uncertainty about postponement)
(C) A ticket for two o'clock, please. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the workshop)

28. How were our production figures last month?
(A) They produce electric cars. → Incorrect (describes products, not figures)
(B) Nine o'clock in the morning. → Incorrect (refers to time, not figures)
(C) We were closed down for a week. → Correct (explains production status)

29. When can I see the speech therapist?
(A) A one-hour session. → Incorrect (refers to duration, not timing)
(B) Just a microphone. → Incorrect (unrelated to scheduling)
(C) How about tomorrow afternoon? → Correct (specifies availability)

30. Aren't you picking up the clients from the airport?
(A) A product demonstration. → Incorrect (unrelated to airport pickup)
(B) No, I believe Tomoko is doing that. → Correct (clarifies who is picking up)
(C) He prefers an aisle seat. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

31. How was your morning client meeting?
(A) It's great to meet you. → Incorrect (unrelated to meeting outcome)
(B) No, over in conference room two. → Incorrect (refers to location, not outcome)
(C) The contract is now officially signed. → Correct (describes the meeting result)
